ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: French 160 is a course that explores many facets of French culture. I would recommend the course if you are planning on taking a level 5 course but do not want to take French literature. However, the course is a lot of work, and vocab quizzes were exceedingly difficult. The oral exams were not terribly hard to prepare for although they were nerve-wracking. There were also a large number of reading and writing assignments. Class discussions were always interesting and engaging (though occasionally boring and drawn-out). If you choose take the course, take it with Madame Pinzka! Her enthusiasm is infectious, and she makes even the more boring topics seem interesting.
Really engaging, but definitely quite a bit of work!

If you think this class will have no writing, you're wrong, but, while frequent, the little essays are super-manageable and really help nail down the vocabulary that you need in order to speak better in class. If you can get a section of under 10, I think that for this particular class that works the best, since it's all about discussion. If you really want a good chance to work on your spoken French at a high level while learning about some of the most current issues in French society, definitely shop this class.
